urls.description: Finnair flies the shortcut between Europe and Asia. Start by selecting your country and preferred language and then proceed to booking your flights.

data.text: Business travel is gradually picking up. We are adding one more weekly frequency from Helsinki to Gothenburg. We now have ten weekly HEL-GOT frequencies. On three weekdays, we operate both morning and evening flights. The flights are available on https://t.co/WWKAxOEyod.

data.text: Autumn rains have arrived in Finland, but in Southern Europe, the summer reaches well into October or November. How about moving your work laptop to a Croatian café or the Italian countryside? https://t.co/QczgZSeYyz

data.text: Great news if you love Italy: we are adding one more weekly connection to both Milan and Rome from the beginning of October. https://t.co/oK95D6dcxg
Flying with us soon? Remember our updated mask guidance: fabric masks are no longer permitted on our flights 👉 https://t.co/c9LWBZrZrT https://t.co/b7fFDdHPne

Our Schengen Lounge opens on 25 Aug. Due to the airport health and safety processes, the entrance is near gate 26. If you have a domestic flight, you can access the Lounge with a special permit that you can get after the security check. Our non-Schengen Lounge remains closed. https://t.co/ivy4AgUKYy

data.text: Please make sure you arrive at the airport at least 2 hours before your flight. It is good to allow some extra time for the travel document checks. https://t.co/cNmXWkIUl6

Safety is always our first priority. Starting today, Finnair will not be using the Afganistan airspace until further notice. This change impacts our Bangkok flights. Diverting the Afganistan airspace will slightly increase the flight time. https://t.co/em8upTv4Hp

data.text: The mask needs to continuously cover your nose and mouth. You can only remove it for a limited time while you’re eating or drinking. Please make sure you always wear a mask when interacting with Finnair employees, whether it’s at the airport or onboard.

Starting 16 August, we will no longer accept fabric masks on our flights. We accept surgical masks, FFP2 or FFP3 respirator masks without a valve or other valve free masks with the same standard (N95). Please remember you need to wear a mask throughout the entire journey. https://t.co/Am4SxtT1G3

data.text: Finnair’s nr 1 sailor @arihuusela continues to fly the Finnish sailing team to Tokyo! Yesterday it was @tuulipetaja's turn to start her journey by visiting the cockpit with coach Borja Carracedo. We wish Tuuli good luck in the games! https://t.co/M97dexXB9z

urls.title: Finnair Lounges at Helsinki Airport
urls.description: Combining Nordic design, atmosphere and hospitality, our lounges at Helsinki Airport invite you to spend a hassle-free moment before your flight. There are three lounges at Helsinki Airport – Finnair Lounge in the Schengen side and Finnair Business Lounge and Finnair Platinum Wing in the non-Schengen side of the airport.

data.text: We will reopen the Finnair Lounge in the Schengen area at Helsinki Airport on 25 August (5:30–23:30 daily) and open the Premium Security lane for morning peak hours (4:30–8:30 Monday– Saturday) on 26 July. https://t.co/lAOoa67M3e

data.text: RT @HofmannAviation: #Finnish invasion - @Finnair will base three @Airbus A350s in Stockholm Arlanda this winter, operating to Bangkok, Phu…

We are opening non-stop flights from Arlanda, Stockholm in Sweden to Bangkok and Phuket in Thailand and Miami in the US for the winter season 2021/2022. data.text: VP of Finnair Traffic Planning Perttu Jolma explains why traditional traffic planning tools don’t work during the pandemic. Find out why it’s so challenging to estimate demand right now and why some flights are still getting cancelled. https://t.co/qbH24mmAjY

Tier upgrades will continue as normal, and the validity of tier benefits will also be extended for six months. In addition, Finnair Plus award points will not expire before the end of March 2022. Check your inbox for more information!

Great news for Finnair Plus members! We are extending your tier tracking periods again and making a further freeze to the expiration of Finnair Plus award points. 
We’ll apply a 6-month extension to your active tier in June or July before your current tier ends. https://t.co/1xS62s7BmB

data.text: Finnair is restarting its flights to Barcelona 16th August and Madrid 1st September with two weekly frequencies. Please check the travel restrictions for your destination before your flight. Tickets are available from today at https://t.co/906IMFcH8u. https://t.co/9Gz2QslA8D

Finnair and Juneyao Air enter to a joint business partnership, where the two carriers cooperate on Helsinki–Shanghai flights as well points beyond in China and Europe. urls.title: Travelling to Finland
urls.description: Finland has opened for travel from the EU and Schengen countries. Travel from outside of the EU and Schengen area remains restricted. Finnish authorities define the entry requirements to Finland. See more detailed instructions below. Please also note that travel restrictions are subject to change at short notice. As a traveller, you are always responsible for ensuring that you fulfil the requirements of your destination and possible transit country. You can check the current entry restrictions to Finland

data.text: New travel guidance to Finland by the Institute of Health and Welfare: no quarantine, no arrival testing for vaccinated travelers, no covid-certificates required for customers under 16 yrs. Restrictions still for non-Finns and foreign non-residents. https://t.co/1ejkHeCzz9

data.text: Greece is open for travel! Thanks to the success of a plan to vaccinate the populations of its smallest islands, Greece has made these often overlooked destinations the perfect alternative for an off-the-beaten track break. https://t.co/gX780vGlcW

Strong growth in number of the Finnair shareholders continued – the company is already the 7th most owned Finnish share with over 106,000 shareholders. Our warmest welcome to all the new owners! https://t.co/QSLeSngnD5 https://t.co/AvFGNdwGTs

data.text: The COVID-19 pandemic impact was still visible in the May passenger traffic figures. In May, Finnair carried 82,800 passengers. Demand for the cargo capacity remained strong. https://t.co/NHIrjQ9S0B https://t.co/j7zIcZABf3
RT @TravelEdNigel: Airline staff on getting planes ready to fly again - from chocks and tyre checks to pilot training. Fascinating insight…

Several of Finnair’s aircraft have been stored in Central Europe during the pandemic. Now we’re gradually flying them back to Helsinki. Read how we’re preparing our aircraft for the ramp up. https://t.co/vKZWPZbELQ

data.text: Where can I travel this summer? Check out our interactive map that shows you the up to date travel guidelines for all of our destinations. https://t.co/l1PgCefjmD https://t.co/CaQwknyjx7

We will discontinue using Belarus airspace until further notice. Our next affected flight is Gazipasa next Wednesday. According to Traficom’s recommendation, this route will avoid Belarus airspace. The change will make flight time a bit longer.

Our customer service is congested at the moment. We are sorry for the situation. If your flight is in August, we ask you to contact us in early June. Thank you for your understanding! Information on cancelled flights on our travel updates page: https://t.co/BhoIvpQRvW
Hats off to our pilot @arihuusela for the amazing achievement of completing @VendeeGlobeENG ! Congratulations! #VG2020 #vahvaamyötätuulta https://t.co/iM05XTvTCi

Metrics move money! Finnair supports the recommendations of the TCFD and is committed to constantly improved disclosures on climate risk. Fantastic work by Nordic CEOs, showing the willingness and drive of corporations in Climate Action. #TFCD #SDG13 #NordicCEOs https://t.co/kiMX1ki7F1

We are resuming our flights to Hong Kong in June! Helsinki–Hong Kong route will be operated once a week on Wednesdays and Hong Kong–Helsinki route on Fridays. The flights are available on our website. https://t.co/mGfa2MGShH https://t.co/Oh4X6xKWgb

Are you eager to spend your Finnair Plus award points, but don’t have quite enough for what you want? Now you can buy additional award points to top up your account. Early birds will get up to 100% bonus points until 21 May. https://t.co/XMnuJ41R5s https://t.co/ZYBTnX8Zr8

urls.title: Fly to over 100 destinations with Finnair
urls.description: Finnair flies the shorter, faster route between Europe and Asia. Modern fleet – more comfort, lower emissions. Search and book your flights today.

data.text: Greece and Portugal are opening their travel. This summer we fly to Heraklion, Rhodes, Chania and Santorini in Greece. In Portugal, our destinations are Porto, Lisbon and Madeira. The flights are available on our website. https://t.co/t5ZbgTfcj8 https://t.co/7t4myD058G

RT @MT111tmd123: Just purchased 9,000 award miles from @Finnair for £66/75EUR.
This is 1,000 miles shy of a business class upgrade on a LHR…

RT @inflightmag: News: Finnair ATR fleet to be fitted with HEPA filters

@Finnair is to begin installing #HEPA filters on the recirculation…

Finnair is installing HEPA filters on the recirculation system of its entire ATR turboprop fleet as one of the first airlines in the world. Our Airbus and Embraer aircraft are already fitted with HEPA filters. https://t.co/XI6NRA8GBL https://t.co/q9bWioreqU

Finnair issues a senior unsecured bond of EUR 400 million. “My warmest thanks to everyone who invested in Finnair's new bond. Due to your strong trust in Finnair, we were able to double its size compared to the previous one”, says CFO @MStirkkinen. https://t.co/mSKLA58qrT

data.text: The COVID-19 pandemic impact was still visible in Finnair's April passenger traffic figures. Finnair carried 80,900 passengers. It was again a very strong month for cargo. https://t.co/UO2qgXHBGC https://t.co/WnW2qym5cn

Finnair now has more than 100,000 shareholders. The amount of shareholders has almost quadrupled in a little over a year. Finnair is currently the 9th most owned Finnish stock. Warm thanks to our shareholders for their trust in Finnair! https://t.co/eq5WdL30VH https://t.co/PNeNqnlh47

Did you know that the Finnair app now also has Customer Service? You can also book travel extras, check in, see your boarding passes and gate numbers, and access your Finnair Plus card.  Read more and download! https://t.co/byHXicayX1

With the possibility of restrictions easing around the globe, we've gradually started getting our cabin crew and pilots primed for a return to the skies. It's vital to ensure everyone's skills remain at the high level they were before the pandemic. https://t.co/5208zMX0Ws

data.text: Finnair in Q1: travel demand remained weak due to travel restrictions, but cargo continued to perform. Our revenue decreased by 79.8% to 113.6 million euros. Gradual recovery of demand is estimated to start from late summer. https://t.co/imuTAI0MT7 https://t.co/SpVKkDi3oD

We will fly to over 60 destinations in summer 2021 – flights will be added as travel gradually opens. In June, we will resume flights to e.g. Reykjavik, Nice, Vilnius and Los Angeles. https://t.co/pOcoNx7agF https://t.co/1UjWxbN4mF

urls.title: Travelling to Finland
urls.description: Finland has opened for travel from the EU and Schengen countries. Travel from outside of the EU and Schengen area remains restricted. Finnish authorities define the entry requirements to Finland. See more detailed instructions below. Please also note that travel restrictions are subject to change at short notice. As a traveller, you are always responsible for ensuring that you fulfil the requirements of your destination and possible transit country. You can check the current entry restrictions to Finland

data.text: We will accept a Covid-19 vaccination certificate as an alternative to a negative test result or a certificate of a previous infection for travellers to Finland as of May 11. https://t.co/diJSSEzRB8 https://t.co/KMkVJdwtkp

Due to construction work, taxis and cars are now leaving travellers in front of Terminal 1 at Helsinki Airport. Please make sure you arrive at least two hours before your departure to leave enough time to make your way to Terminal 2. https://t.co/pfmexVyx4M
RT @yocova_: Read about a recycling first as @Finnair uses in-house MRO staff to dismantle an Airbus A319. @thatjohn finds out about the pr…
RT @ArgusMedia: News story - Finland's @NesteGlobal has supplied 300t of #SAF (#biojet) to @Finnair at Helsinki airport to reduce carbon em…

urls.title: Neste and Finnair present Sustainable Aviation Fuel based solution to reduce business travel emissions
urls.description: Neste Corporation, Press Release, 13 April 2021 at 9 a.m. (EET) Neste and Finnair are joining forces to reduce carbon emissions related to Neste employees’ business travel by using Sustainable Aviation Fuel (SAF). Neste has recently made 300 tons of Neste MY Sustainable Aviation Fuel™ available at Helsinki Airport in Finland for Finnair’s use. By replacing a part of the fossil jet fuel with SAF...

data.text: Finnair starts to fly with #SAF from Helsinki Airport as we are presenting Sustainable Aviation Fuel based solution to reduce business travel emissions with @NesteGlobal Read more: https://t.co/uQznpc6NqJ
New partnership with ePassi means Finnair Plus members can use points at over 15,000 merchants in Finland. https://t.co/bq0eTHs6Jr
In March, Finnair carried 86,300 passengers, which was 82.7% less than in March 2020. The number of passengers in March 2021 was 1.1% less than in February 2021. https://t.co/4ORlbjL3Zd

Rentoudu ja nauti tänä pääsiäisenä herkullisista, Finnairin huippukokkien suunnittelemista ja käsin keittiössämme Vantaalla tehdyistä Taste of Finnair -makuelämyksistä. Katso koko menu sivuiltamme: https://t.co/8ksg4gMRAu

data.text: Finnair will today begin flights to Mars, a destination that currently does not have any travel restrictions. We have modified two Airbus A350 aircraft in our fleet as space shuttles. https://t.co/PC5RPNbph7

Today, @alaskaair officially joined @traveloneworld and we are celebrating with the #GlobalSafetyDance! Our #oneworldalliance members got in the fun and showed off their world-class moves. Learn more about Alaska Airlines: https://t.co/bULKm8U31N https://t.co/AaVtOAmA2O

Due to system maintenance Finnair Plus services are unavailable between Thursday 25 March 2021 at 21:00 (EET) and Monday 29 March at 10:00 (EET). Our apologies for the inconvenience and thank you for your patience. https://t.co/znUKZj7s0X

entity.name: COVID-19: Latest news updates from around the world
entity.description: This page is a timeline of Tweets with the latest information and updates on COVID-19 from experts, journalists, health authorities and other trusted sources from around the world. For more on COVID-19, visit: twitter.com/explore/tabs/covid-19

data.text: A highly important message to domestic travellers from the Helsinki airport corona sniffing dogs Rele and Milka: “Come and get sniffed by us at the arrivals hall after your domestic flight! It’s free, good for your health, and if you’re lucky, you might get to pet us!” https://t.co/xLB6Bf0ybs

We are starting flights from Helsinki to Alicante with one weekly frequency from May 1. Naturally, you can only travel if you fulfil the travel requirements in the destination or transit country. The flights are now on sale on our website and mobile app. https://t.co/LUmL6mwAsC https://t.co/EX8BFCQVKh

Finnair could acquire up to 20 Heart Aerospace ES-19 electric aircraft for use on shortest haul routes. These planes could be a part of the toolbox of new technologies in helping Finnair meet its plans to be carbon neutral by 2045. https://t.co/4c9RPDxEl8
Finnair shows green light to electric flying, signs a letter of interest on electric aircraft developed by Heart Aerospace. https://t.co/VVb1Nm2pz5

data.text: During 2020, there were fewer than 50 Covid infections caught onboard a plane. At the same time, there were 1.2 billion air travellers globally. So even if the real number of cases was tenfold, the probability of contracting Covid remains extremely small. https://t.co/nr8KZutobB

data.text: The Finnair Annual General Meeting was held today in Vantaa, under special arrangements due to the Covid-19 pandemic. Read the decisions of the shareholders on our website. https://t.co/3TBEuubtbt

Finnish consumers ranked Finnair as the most sustainable brand within airlines in the #sbindex2021 survey. Read more on what we have done for #sustainability and our ambitious CO2 reduction targets over the past year: https://t.co/ecuP697Xli
